entry.title: [EditContext] Clear composition_range at the same point as has_composition_ flag
entry.content:
In EditContext::CommitText,

composition_range_start_/composition_range_end_ are cleared before

textupdate and compositionend are fired, while has_composition_ is

cleared after. This can result in the following sequence of events:



1) CommitText is called upon finishing a composition. composition_range_

is cleared, and then DispatchTextUpdateEvent is called.

2) During the textupdate event handler, the page calls

editContext.updateSelection()

3) In EditContext::updateSelection(), we go down the codepath where we

have an active composition but a composition_range_ at zero, in

which EditContext::updateSelection() sets the composition_range_

to the selection position

4) Back in CommitText, has_composition_ is cleared. Now we are an

inconsistent state where we have no composition but have a

nonzero composition_range_.

5) A new composition is started, and we enter

EditContext::SetComposition(). This ends up using the

composition_range that was set in step (3), which is incorrect.

Thus the now composition gets placed at the wrong spot, when

it should have been populated from the current selection position.



In this CL, fix the issue by clearing

composition_range_start_/composition_range_end_ at the same place

as has_composition_ is cleared, so the EditContext is always

in a consistent state.



Bug: 999184

Change-Id: I64d45c005dd64f7448fdc3cefcbe87b06ec93b44

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4717588

entry.title: Add a field allowedReportingOrigins to ad object.
entry.content:
Add a new optional field `allowedReportingOrigins` to interest group's

ads' ad object. It contains a list of origins that can receive reports

with macros. The list must contain no more than 10 elements, and all

origins must be HTTPS, otherwise fail the interest group and do not

join/update.



The API that registers reports for the origins will be added in a future

CL.

entry.title: [ChromeRefresh2023] Align items in menu using GM3
entry.content:
GM3 dialogs have slightly larger margins than before. Extensions menu

contents was using some variables that did not account for this,

causing the contents to no be aligned with the dialog title (whose

margin was affected by GM3).



Therefore, we updated the contents to use the new margins that take

into account GM3 and non-GM3, ensuring that items are still aligned for non GM3.

entry.title: Use correct RenderFrameHost in SystemWebDialogDelegate::OnDialogShown
entry.content:
This function currently retrieves the RFH for setting a temporary zoom

level via WebContents::GetPrimaryMainFrame(). While this happens to

work today, this is generally incorrect, as OnDialogShown is called

from WebUIRenderFrameCreated during a navigation to a WebUI, and the

WebUI could be created for a speculative RenderFrameHost if the

navigation is cross-process, in which case GetPrimaryMainFrame() would

return an incorrect RFH that we're navigating from, rather than the RFH that will end up committing the navigation. An upcoming refactor of the

early RFH swap optimization in //content exposes this as a failure in

SystemWebDialogTest.PageZoom (see CL:4656206).



This function already has a content::WebUI object, which provides a

GetRenderFrameHost() accessor for getting the right RFH, so switch

to using that instead.

Change-Id: I772f1d58aeccca3e05b01ed228cdf8bf9f9d12e3

entry.title: qrcode: use WeakPtr for WebContents
entry.content:
This removes the last untriaged raw_ptr in this class.



Despite extensive analysis, it is not clear to me that the pointed-to

WebContents will always outlive the QRCodeGeneratorBubble. Even if that

analysis *had* proven that the WebContents always outlives

QRCodeGeneratorBubble, any future reader of this code would have to redo

the analysis themselves or simply trust that my reasoning was correct

and still valid, which seems like a bad deal. It's better to make the

code obviously correct to a casual reader.



Here's the analysis:

The WebContents itself is owned by the TabStripModel and therefore

indirectly by the Browser; its lifetime is partly under the control of

the user and partly under the control of the website itself, due to the

existence of window.close(). The WebContents is generally destroyed as

part of tab closure.



The QRCodeGeneratorBubble is owned (indirectly) by a views::Widget,

which is in turn owned by a views::NativeWidget, which is owned by "the

operating system", sort of. In particular, views::NativeWidget is

usually destroyed as part of views::Widget::Close(), asynchronously.



In theory, LocationBarBubbleDelegateView (a superclass of

QRCodeGeneratorBubble) is responsible for closing that Widget, in

response to WebContentsObserver::WebContentsDestroyed(). At the very

least, that code appears to ensure that a close has *started* before the

WebContents itself is destroyed. Since the close is asynchronous,

though, it is not obvious that the close is *finished* before the

WebContents is destroyed, which means the web_contents_ pointer may

dangle temporarily during window teardown. To make matters worse, even

after the window has started closing, queued UI events may still arrive,

and I believe that QRCodeGeneratorBubble::DownloadButtonPressed()

*could* still be reached while the Widget has not yet finished closing

but the WebContents has been destroyed. How often this would happen in

practice is an open question, but it is not certain (to me) that it's

impossible.



Fixed: 1467536

Change-Id: I619498da899d5db5edd9dba5502919a3b77536fd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4722488

authentication flows in the ChromeOS lock screen. This verifies that

navigation is not possible to URLs matching a value in the new policy

login screen's `SAMLPolicyTest.SAMLBlocklistNavigationDisallowed`

browser test.

This CL introduces the following:

1. WebAppRegistrar functionalities to read from DB if an app is the

default supported app for link capturing, and if there are other apps

entry.title: [PA] Make base a public_deps of c/power_bookmarks/common

The public interface of this target do include several headers from

base. It means `base` is a `public_deps`, not an internal `deps`.



See GN doc explaining this:

https://gn.googlesource.com/gn/+/master/docs/reference.md#discussion

going to be properly propagated toward all of its dependants. It will

fail to compile the ":test_support" target here.

entry.title: Revert "[LCPP] Store LCP element locator in database via mojo"
entry.content:
This reverts commit cf4361574a68b5e67aeac94945ad873c508bc04e.



Reason for revert: Consistently failing on linux-bfcache-rel.



Sample failure:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-bfcache-rel/49473



Original change's description:

> [LCPP] Store LCP element locator in database via mojo

>

> This CL stores LCP element locator information in the

> database. Specifically, this CL does the following things:

>

> - Send LCP element locator candidates from renderer to browser via mojo

> (LCPCriticalPathPredictor and LCPCriticalPathPredictorHost do this).

>

> - Send LCP element locator candidates to

> LcpCriticalPathPredictorPageLoadMetricsObserver.

>

> - The latest LCP element locator will be kept in

> LcpCriticalPathPredictorPageLoadMetricsObserver.

>

> - Save the latest LCP element locator in the database on complete.

>

> - Provides PredictLcpElementLocators() for prediction. (This is needed

> for test.)

>

entry.content:
This CL fixes a bug in default browser promo that happens when the promo is displayed and the app is backgrounded. When the app is backgrounded and the user opens chrome back up, a new default browser promo manager is starting. This CL checks if there is an existing default browser promo before starting a new one.

entry.title: Clean-up WebDatabase golden files.
entry.content:
Some of the golden files contains INSERT statements. Ideally, these

files should only reflect the database schema, not data inside the

tables.



This CL removes any insert statements. In two cases (version 83 and 85),

the migration unit tests actually depend on the data, by checking that

it does (not) change after the migration. In these cases, the INSERT

statements are moved to the tests themselves. There, the INSERTs are

cleaned-up slightly, by specifying which columns are actually being

inserted.

entry.title: Moves clang coverage processing into test plugin
entry.content:
Because during xcode parallel runs multiple clones of simulators are

used and cleaned up by xcode, tests need to pause just before test completion

to pull profraw coverage files out of the simulators.



This requires adding a new callback to the plugin based on

TestBundleDidFinish. Additionally calls to the plugins should pass

any identifying information for the simulator its running in so that the right simulator can be targeted.



Bug: 1458521

entry.title: Add affiliation tests for local content analysis policies
entry.content:
This adds tests to enforce that ConnectorsService will always return a

value for content analysis policies set to a local provider value,

regardless of the affiliation status.



This CL also tweaks existing code/tests to enforce that non-ENTERPRISE_LOCAL_CONTENT_ANALYSIS platforms (aka CrOS) never get

settings with a local provider and set the per_profile field

accurately when the DM token is missing. This is not strictly a bug

as that value is not currently used by LCAC, but given that

logic is used only in per_profile cases it's best to make sure it's

accurate now to avoid future bugs.



Bug: b/238322658

entry.title: dlp: Re-enable DLP/DlpFilesAppBrowserTest.Test/transferShowDlpToast
entry.content:
The test was flaky because of a race between files_controller deletion

in TearDownOnMainThread and the execution of

AppServiceProxyAsh::CreateIntentLaunchInfo that sometimes was using an

invalid files_controller object.



The code has been reorganized to not require anymore an explicit

deletion of files_controller, so the object should survive the execution

of AppServiceProxyAsh::CreateIntentLaunchInfo.



Bug: b/291674465

Test: tools/autotest.py -C out/Default ./chrome/browser/ash/file_manager/file_manager_browsertest.cc --gtest_filter=DLP/DlpFilesAppBrowserTest.Test/transferShowDlpToast --gtest_repeat=1000





dlp: Remove explicit DlpFilesControllerAsh deletion in tests



Currently DlpFilesControllerAsh is explicitely deleted in TearDown

methods to make sure that DlpExtractIOTaskObserver stops observing

IOTaskController before the latter is destroyed.

After https://crrev.com/c/4718448 this will no longer be needed since we

are now listening to shut down events from VolumeManager (that owns

IOTaskController), so we can stop observing as soon as this event is

received.



Bug: b/293261432





dlp: Stop observing IOTaskObserver when VolumeManager is shut down



Bug: b/293253544

Change-Id: I9ac26ad04a9d2a9deccdc449260049d9bd750ee5

entry.title: Reland "[DownloadBubble] Fix notification behavior for Lacros tab fullscreen"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit cc3a8e9efbafefa405012d6d3d16c97da0a97a54



The reland removes most of the test changes (those unrelated to the

main change), and retains only the test for tab fullscreen which

has behavior changes in this CL.



The other tests will be rewritten at a later point.



Original change's description:

> [DownloadBubble] Fix notification behavior for Lacros tab fullscreen

>

> There are two types of fullscreen, browser fullscreen (where the whole

> browser is fullscreen), and tab fullscreen (where an element on the web

> page requests fullscreen). Before this patch, the behavior of browser

> fullscreen downloads is that we show an exclusive access bubble with

> wording instructing the user to exit fullscreen to view their downloads,

> and then show the partial view upon exiting fullscreen. When not in

> immersive fullscreen mode, tab fullscreen should work the same way.

> However, this was not working properly in tab fullscreen on Lacros,

> where the exclusive access bubble was not being shown.

>

> The issue was that we were passing an empty GURL to the exclusive access

> context, which signifies browser (immersive on ChromeOS) fullscreen.

> Since we always pass an empty GURL when notify_download is true, the

> fix in this CL is to modify the logic in BrowserView so that the check

> for a non-empty URL is skipped for notify_download == true. The logic

> for immersive fullscreen is handled already by the download controller

> anyway.

>

> Also adds interactive UI tests for both browser and tab fullscreen.

>

> Bug: 1361511

> Change-Id: I9ac08ba46a60474db445d15e2394a8cc045ee531

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4652317

> Reviewed-by: Trent Apted

> Commit-Queue: Lily Chen

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1174447}



Bug: 1361511

Change-Id: Ie29e1ebc2ef4df90060ce83830f3d73a4d815605

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4722256

entry.title: Revert "Change device ownership retrieval in ChromeUserManager"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4384f99478389c59c9d2ed51ed4b343274b6055a.



Reason for revert: Lacros does not launch (crbug.com/1468164, b/293395333 for more details)



Original change's description:

> Change device ownership retrieval in ChromeUserManager

>

> This change fixes the problems with device ownership retrieval

> outlined in go/async-ownership-retrieval.

> Currently, the device owner is set everyt time

> `RetrieveTrustedDevicePolicies` is called. This results in multiple

> calls to `SetOwner` with a an invalid account id (since the owner wasn't

> yet final). This change fixes the issue by decoupling setting the owner

> and calling `RetrieveTrustedDevicePolicies`.

>

> This CL furthermore renames `GetOwnershipAccountIdAsync` to

> `RequestOwnershipAccountId`.

>

> Bug: b/245337406, b/287416180

> Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*ApiGuardDelegateTest*"

> Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*UserManagerTest*"

entry.title: dlp: Remove explicit DlpFilesControllerAsh deletion in tests
entry.content:
Currently DlpFilesControllerAsh is explicitly deleted in TearDown

methods to make sure that DlpExtractIOTaskObserver stops observing

IOTaskController before the latter is destroyed.

After https://crrev.com/c/4718448 this will no longer be needed since we

are now listening to shut down events from VolumeManager (that owns

IOTaskController), so we can stop observing as soon as this event is

received.

entry.title: Integrate ProfileTokenQuality into AutofillProfile.
entry.content:
Adds a ProfileTokenQuality member to AutofillProfile and adds logic to

collect observations on form submit.



Since forms can be filled with multiple profiles, ProfileTokenQuality::

SaveObservationsForFilledFormForAllSubmittedProfiles() is introduced,

which essentially calls AddObservationsForFilledForm() for all profiles

that were used to fill the form. On form submit (in the manager), this

function is called to collect the observations.



The logic is guarded by a new feature flag

AutofillTrackProfileTokenQuality.



Bug: 1453650

Change-Id: I0ae979573b10d3e9928870bb8d781bbc5fe0473c

entry.content:

and chromium.gpu.fyi from 60 to 30 minutes. This is still significantly

longer than most tests/configurations need, but should still help

prevent wasting time on clearly bad shards until we can come up with a

better, more targeted solution.

entry.title: [LCPP] Store LCP element locator in database via mojo
entry.content:
This CL stores LCP element locator information in the

database. Specifically, this CL does the following things:



- Send LCP element locator candidates from renderer to browser via mojo

(LCPCriticalPathPredictor and LCPCriticalPathPredictorHost do this).



- Send LCP element locator candidates to

LcpCriticalPathPredictorPageLoadMetricsObserver.



- The latest LCP element locator will be kept in

LcpCriticalPathPredictorPageLoadMetricsObserver.



- Save the latest LCP element locator in the database on complete.



- Provides PredictLcpElementLocators() for prediction. (This is needed

for test.)



To send the LCP element locator from LCPCriticalPathPredictorHost to

LcpCriticalPathPredictorPageLoadMetricsObserver, this CL uses the

PageUserData.



https://docs.google.com/document/d/1waakt6bSvedWdaUQ2mC255NF4k8j7LybK2dQ7WptxiE

entry.title: [text-autospace] Fix surrogate pairs
entry.content:
This patch fixes when `TextAutoSpace::ApplyIfNeeded` handles

surrogate pairs. It uses `U16_NEXT` etc. but stores the

results to `UChar`, cutting off the higher 16 bits. This patch

fixes it to `UChar32`.



This patch has no behavior changes as all changes are under a

runtime flag.

entry.title: Use 'ALTER TABLE DROP COLUMN' syntax in AutofillTable.
entry.content:
Follow-up to crrev.com/c/4712116 - turns out Chromium supports the

'ALTER TABLE DROP COLUMN' syntax for a long time. AutofillTable just

kept blindly following the same pattern*.



- SQLite version 3.35 introduced the syntax,

https://www.sqlite.org/releaselog/3_35_0.html

- Chromium uses version 3.42,

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/sqlite/README.chromium



To use the DROP COLUMN syntax, the migration logic needs to specify

which column gets deleted (right now it only specifies the complement,

the other columns that should be retained). To find out the column

names that were dropped, the diffs between the golden files in

components/test/data/web_database/ were used.



* This was the first CL that introduced this pattern back in 2020, when

the SQLite version actually didn't support the syntax.

http://crrev.com/c/1980751/18/components/autofill/core/browser/webdata/autofill_table.cc



Bug: 1007974

Change-Id: I3d9d04866d351bf4fe64de0d00d41543e054c3ab

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4724186

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Jihad Hanna

entry.title: FSA: Update `GetOriginsWithGrants` to return a set
entry.content:
Update the return type of `GetOriginsWithGrants` so that it returns a

set of unique origins, eliminating the possibility of duplication.

currently called anywhere in the code, and will not be needed for

entry.title: [sync] Fix migrating autofill.wallet_import_enabled from old profiles
entry.content:
The migration code, introduced recently in https://crrev.com/c/4686250,

overlooked an edge case concerning profiles created 5+ years ago and

for users that at the time chose to "choose what to sync" (currently

"customize sync") advanced sync settings, without actually turning off

the payments toggle.



This is because the payments toggle was only integrated into sync

settings around 2018, with https://codereview.chromium.org/1578173005/

or https://codereview.chromium.org/2068653003.



Hence, for the affected profiles, they reflect that sync-everything is

off, but autofill.wallet_import_enabled isn't populated (and defaults

to true). Unless this scenario is special-cased, the post-migration

state considers payments off, because the new preferences, as

registered in SyncPrefs::RegisterTypeSelectedPref(), default to false.



The solution in this patch specifically handles the problematic

scenario. Doing so makes it harder to determine whether the migration

needs to be exercised, so a second preference is introduced for this

purpose.



Change-Id: Id7867d5510503dff98d9845d8afb20a215c655f6

Bug: 1467307

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4720970
